page.title: 20AN ORDINARY DAY.
page.content: I get up at 7.00am and get breakfast, feed the dog whilst Vicki sees to the 2 horses. I walk to school by 8.15am and prepare for the day's lessons,open the post and talk with the children as they start arriving about 8.30am. After school finishes, I stay until about 5.30pm marking books,displaying work and writing letters. On getting home I usually find that Vicki is out riding so I have my tea, read the paper and perhaps write a letter to my husband, who is away at sea, or my eldest daughter who is at University. The evening is either spent at a meeting(PTA.,Governors,Headteachers or Pony Club) or I watch the television. The travelling Library calls once a fortnight. A butcher calls every week and sometimes a Fishman. We have oil central heating and electricity for cooking and lighting.
